result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Eugene Heintz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian Eugene Heintz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 2:28 p.m.  Defendant Brian Eugene Heintz in court.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thorie - guilty plea, fine of $265.60.  No jail or probation. Court reviews defendant's right to have an attorney.  Defendant willingly waives his right to an attorney. Court approves waiver of Defendant's right to an attorney.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Count 1.    Facts are correct.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.    The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Count 1.  Court orders fine in the amount of $265.60. and $200.00. DNA surcharge.   3 months to pay.  Appeal rights are given to defendant.

ADDRESS INFO for Brian Eugene Heintz
Current: N3329 730th St, Elk Mound, WI 54739 United States  (Effective: 02-19-2016)
Prior: 430 E. Wall Street, Ellsworth, WI 54011

3:48 Defendant Brian Eugene Heintz in court  Def from PCJ, in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appeared in court via phone.   Defendant has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Court goes over the Defs rights again, as he couldn't hear with a fan starting in video conferencing room. Def pleas not guilty. Thorie: $500 signature bond. Nelson has no objection.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
